ui::​Dialog
public
ui::​Widget
public
ui.​IDialog
ui::​Dialog
ui::​Pager

A dialog is used to display a frame on the screen.  The normal way to use a dialog is to instantiate it, then set its title and content widget values

there are two defaut dialog types that supply buttons:

  • InfoDialog supplies an "OK" button only

  • ConfirmationDialog supplies an "OK" and "CANCEL" button

To setup custom buttons, `buttons` can be modified before the dialog is first shown.

When these buttons are clicked, the on_button_selected callback in the Dialog will be called

Functions
position_dialog
virtual void position_dialog():

override position_dialog if you want to control where the dialog is placed on the page. by default, the dialog will be centered

on_button_selected
virtual void on_button_selected(
string s
):

this is called when the dialog's buttons are pressed
